column24: What are the difficulties you encounter during the COVID-19 pandemic?
column25: Do you have some recommendations for improving the quality of distance learning?
Let us learn on site, face-to-face.

I understand that most professors are over 40 years old, but that cannot be an excuse for them being incompetent when it comes to using online platforms. I expect a proper attitude with which a professor can motivate his students to study, and not send us an article when the time for the lecture comes, instead of an actual lecture. This is farcical. I don't want teachers to force our presence when they are unable to turn on the microphone and share a screen. I expect at the very least the lecture material to be sent to us after the lecture in the group mail, as is done in any university. I can go on indefinitely, but I am skeptical that this poll will change anything. Rather, it is for activity reporting. Thanks!
I think we should switch back to face to face learning, online learning does not work.
It would be best to bring us back to a normal learning environment (back to the seminar rooms). This will improve the learning process.
Training must be face-to-face.
Let's go back to the face-to-face form.
All teachers should start taking students’ interest into consideration, not just a few of them!
Let’s stop distance learning
Learning must be face-to-face.
There should be more experience sharing, case studies and practical tasks in classes.
No more online learning
Yes
Yes
Use one platform for all subjects.
Distance learning should not be considered an option at all. The exaggerated "pandemic" must not deprive people of access to quality education.
Let us just go back to normal lectures.

I think it would be preferable to replace writing papers with some interesting practical tasks that will develop our critical thinking and imagination. Students’ papers take a lot of time, and we often have several papers with the same deadline. This leads to a mess and does not give enough knowledge.
Web-cameras should be mandatory switched on so that the efficiency of the training process can be improved.

It would be useful to give students the opportunity to participate in various organized online practical tasks. In this way, students will be able to put into practice the knowledge of Mathematics and Informatics from the lecture course. It will be extremely useful if the tasks are made and presented in a more interesting way.
Professors should give more group tasks.
Students should be given more tasks requiring out of class work so that learning material can be reduced.
In order to improve online learning quality, it is necessary to provide access to all educational materials – lecture and test questions after each lecture.
We should stick to only one platform (for example, Moodle) in which we can find all disciplines, because now we use three different platforms.
Distance learning is not the best option for learning. As soon as possible, I would like to return to the classrooms, where learning quality is better.
Each lecture should be recorded and forwarded to students. Create an online library, so we can access more information.
Let’s use only one training platform in which all materials, tests, trainings and links are available in one place.
Let’s use various methods for teaching the material.
More frequent breaks should be taken during distance learning so that we can protect our vision from the harmful effects of device screens.
Sometimes there are problems with hearing the instructor.
I think the internet quality of teachers should be improved.
There should be more examples and tasks in courses. Currently provided examples and tasks are not sufficient for online learning.
Providing free online learning tools, such as a tablet or smartphone.
Professors should send the teaching material, because often we have nowhere else to get it from. In many cases, professors do not give us enough time to write down the text from presentations.
Emphasize explanations instead of teaching by reading presentations.
Emphasizing dialogue in the learning process would contribute more to learning.
All lectures and exercises should be recorded.

I, personally, do not approve of distance learning; I would recommend giving more practical assignments, and not just writing homework and papers, which during the online training, I find are more abundant than they were in the face-to-face form. The fact is that this helps students be assessed in the given discipline, but causes a lot of discomfort, such as headache from standing in front of the computer, back pain from standing for long hours in front of a laptop or computer, for people wearing glasses this may increase diopters, etc. Moreover, in general, isolation leads to depression. It would be much more effective for a student of Finance, for example, to work in a bank for 4 hours a day than to write homework or listen to a lecture, especially if he/she is a student in their third or fourth year.
Exam times should be set more considerately, i.e. there should be more preparation time.

Professors are great and do their best to give us the best possible level of teaching, given the situation, which, in addition to being difficult for us, is many times more difficult for them. I have no specific recommendations, because it can be seen that each of our professors does everything possible to make the learning process both useful and entertaining, because it is difficult to keep students’ attention in an online room for so long.
